fields.description:
As a companion to addVersion, we'd like to automate the release of versions.

Using JIRA versions in a per-build scenario, I'd like to
a) create a new version
b) release the old version (w/date & assigning open issue's fix version)

releaseVersion?
fields.summary: Add a releaseVersion method to the XML interfaces

fields.description:
Hi.

There seems to be a caching issue when updating a duedate from SOAP. I am using the RPC API through .NET.

When I update the duedate through SOAP, the issue does get updated : I browse to the Issue Details page and can see "Due : ..." with the correct date I just entered through SOAP. However, when accessing this issue trough a filter the duedate is set to null.

The same results appear with using the filter from JIRA or through SOAP.

Tell me if you need any more information
fields.summary: Update of duedate via SOAP does not fully work

fields.description: The links to the images and stylesheets in JIRA are secured in the webapp. We are using the NTLM authorization plugin and this causes lots of problems. When the user opens the HTML email in Outlook, they are prompted for username and password. The username and password are cached. After password changes, the user ends up being locked out of JIRA until we clear thier caches.
fields.summary: Links to Images in HTML Email are Secure

fields.description:
Export to Excel sometimes loses Jira items.  I'm not sure of the exact circumstances but it appears to do it mostly when I have the "Issue Links" column in my export, so it might be related to the size of the "Issue Links" field.

To reproduce, go here http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa
and try searching with Project=JIRA and Query="link".  For me this returns 969 items at the moment.  If I export to excel then I only get 903 issues in the resulting spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Excel export with "Issue Links" column loses rows

| bug_status  |
+-------------+
| UNCONFIRMED |
| NEW         |
| ASSIGNED    |
| REOPENED    |
| NEEDINFO    |
| RESOLVED    |
| VERIFIED    |
| CLOSED      |

8 rows in set (0.03 sec)

fields.description:
The following sequence of operations leads to an empty page:
- "Administration", "Permission Schemes", "Copy of the Default Permission Scheme", I get a copy then, though if I try
  to edit or delete it I get an empty result page

In the atlassian-jira.log I see:

[SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.fillBank] first select failed: trying to add row, result set was empty for sequence: PermissionScheme

I don't know if this is related.
fields.summary: Getting an empty page when editing a permission schema

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 7th Sep 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#dddddd|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

We're excited to announce that the ability to split issue is available in JIRA Software 7.5 starting from today!
We really appreciate your patience with this feature request, and apologize for our silence on the matter. We also appreciate the insights in this thread - it helped a ton in the design and prioritization of split issue.

Merging issues is really a separate feature request which we'll prioritise independently and is tracked in JRASERVER-3592. In hindsight we should have separated the two a long time ago, but we promise we will use all the comments around resolutions from this suggestion in the design of the feature, so no need to put the same comments, just make sure to vote and watch the issue! We will provide further updates in there.

As we've mentioned before, our Cloud and Server deployment options are now on separate roadmaps ([read more here|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/prioritizing-roadmaps-cloud-server-data-center]), but split issue is a great example of a new feature shipped in cloud, that was popular and prioritized with server customers, that we have brought into server.

JIRA Software 7.5 is now available to [download|https://atlassian.com/software/jira/download] so you can start planning your upgrade straight away!
Learn more in our [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-release-notes-776821069.html].

Cheers,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, JIRA Server
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10015].
{panel}
You have an issue and in time there are let's say 5 duplicates.
 You see all these issues in the lists and managing them all can be a bit frustrating.
 Maybe we need a merge button so we can merge the duplicate(s) with the original and close the duplicate(s) all with one click

If I say merge then you automagically think of a split issue option to. (create 2 or more subtasks for the original issue with some sort of split wizard)

fields.description: If JIRA is killed during a reindex, or some other indexing operation, it leaves a lockfile on disk which prevents JIRA starting up cleanly. To avoid this, we could add a shutdown hook ([Runtime.addShutdownHook()|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/lang/Runtime.html#addShutdownHook(java.lang.Thread)] - a JDK 1.3 method) which cleans up any unused locks.
fields.summary: Prevent index locks breaking restarts with JVM shutdown hook
Windows: Investigate redirecting output of Tomcat

fields.description:
Need to add documentation discussing DB connection pool size and possible effects this setting may have.

[JRA-10006|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10006] disusses increasing the *maxActive* setting in the shipped server.xml files and notes possible results of having this connection set too low. 

By default, Tomcat configures the *maxActive* setting to be 8.
fields.summary: Docs: Add documentation on DB connection pool size

fields.description:
Tomcat defaults the maximum number of DB connections in the pool - *maxActive* - to 8.

This should be increased in our included server.xml file to allow for more concurrent connections to the DB - perhaps 20.

Lack of connections can result in various problems:

* system hangs - if JIRA locks waiting for another connection to become available 

Further documentation on this setting is available at:

http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/dbcp/configuration.html

Example server.xml entry:

{code}
<Resource url="jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://192.168.0.89:1433/polycom" 
password="jira" 
name="jdbc/JiraDS" 
driverClassName="net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver" 
type="javax.sql.DataSource" 
auth="Container"
username="jira"
maxActive="20">
</Resource>
{code}
fields.summary: Tomcat Config: Increase *maxActive* database pool connection limit

fields.description:
{panel:title=Current Status|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#2E9AFE|bgColor=#E6E6E6}
Dear valued customers,

This ticket was originally created to address the concern that JIRA Administrators should be able to manage *SHARED* filters which are owned by other users. JIRA Team has successfully implemented that feature and thus considered this ticket DONE. Currently we have no plan to implement the ability to manage *PRIVATE* filters yet. More insights can be found in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9997?focusedCommentId=672338&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-672338].

However, we welcome any feedback and thoughts on the significance of this feature. Please kindly use JRA-41269 to track this feature request from now onwards.

Thanks & best regards,
Atlassian Team
{panel}

{panel:title=Original Description|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#01DF3A|bgColor=#E6E6E6}
We have a lot of users who share filters. The problem is that only the creator can change the filter. So if you have users that aren't there anymore ....

I think I need a pane were a administrator can manage filters.
=> delete, change, add filter
also change 
  the creator of the filter (if the user is removed or is to be removed and you want to keep the filter)
  the share level of the filter
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage filters owned by other users

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9996].
  {panel}

Now an issue is open (no resolution) or closed (a resolution) this is also shown in the form of a green color or a red color.
A lot of the time issues are somewhere in between these two.
fi: Waiting for a meeting, On hold (because there blocked by something else, ...)
For these issues I would like a third option let's say color orange issues that are on Hold.

? Also needed for this ?
This means one or 2 extra workflow steps (Waiting for a meeting and on Hold)
Extra statusses Waiting for a meeting and On Hold.
fields.summary: Allow to specify colour for statuses and resolutions

fields.description:
{panel:borderStyle=solid}We are tracking this request in our new Importer Plugin here: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-257

You may also like to read the latest [CSV import|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+From+CSV] documentation.
{panel}

\\
We use the CSV importer to regularly import new issues from the bug tracking system of a customer.
With the wizard it was very easy to initially define a mapping between the 2 systems.

The problem is, the CSV importer of Jira can do only INSERT, no UPDATE.
So we have to manually update Jira to keep it in sync with the customers bug tracker.
Our customers do not change very often the issues after we get them, but sometimes they do
and as projects are getting bigger this is becoming too much to handle manually.

Are there any plans to add to the CSV importer the capability to update already imported issues?

Or are there any other solutions to this problem?
Are there any "standard" Jira solutions?

As I see the Jira CSV importer was created as a tool to import data from another system once,
not to keep data in sync between two systems. But with a small(?) extension it could be made into one.
I just could not find this issue anywhere here in Jira's Jira. We need a solution quite urgently.

Regards
Bettina Zucker
fields.summary: Extend CSV import to update already imported issues

fields.description:
When viewing wiki-style rendered comments fields, in Internet Explorer, scrolling causes corruption in the formatted text. I'll attach a screenshot.

Note that if I resize the window, the corruption goes away.  Any further scrolling reproduces the issue.  It's mostly intermittent rows of whitespace.
fields.summary: Rendering wiki-style comments using IE causes corruption when scrolling

fields.description:
This message handler can assign an issue to the CC address of imported emails. I would like the possibility to perhaps have a ccwatcher=true that added all the the users in cc to the watchers list.

I use JIRA for project I run for customers and I would like JIRA to sometimes notify several involved employees (at the customer) when an issue is fixed. I often get bug or feature requests pr. mail an I use to forward these to an email account where JIRA pick's them up, and if I by adding some users to cc could make sure that they were notified of updates in JIRA that would be a nice feature... :-)
fields.summary: CreateOrCommentHandler - cc to watchers

fields.description:
Hi,
How to increase JVM allocated in standalone JIRA version 3.5.1. As whenever I see JVM utilization in system section in JIRA it shows to me 90% + and consumes a lot of CPU. Where as on server a lot of memory is free. I can allocate more than 1 GB to JVM.  
Please can you tell me how to do this?

Thanks in advance.

Nimesh Joshi
fields.summary: How to increase JVM allocated in standalsone JIRA version 3.5.1

fields.summary: There is a bug when i click on some filters. what can i do to fix it? Here are the error messages:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9979].
  {panel}

Currently the support system has 486k notificationinstances in JIRA's support system.  There is no way currently to clean them up easily.

If we can add a 'created' column to the notificationinstance table, then we can periodically remove ones that aren't relevant anymore.

For the old ones, can we have an upgrade task that sets the created date to be either the date of upgrade, or the date of update of the issue?

h3. Notes

Please refer to [Preparing for JIRA 5.2|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+5.2] for a thorough explanation about how the changes within this improvement request affect JIRA and the way it now handles mail.
fields.summary: NotificationInstance's should have a creation date, and a service to clean them up

  {panel}

Investigate the behaviour of Windows Outlook editor in replying to JIRA HTML emails.

* Reported that comments are all placed on one line when Outlook editor is configured to not use Word. 
* Further, using Outlook as the editor, if there are no blank lines between the text and the original text (or the horizontal rule), JIRA will eat the comment. Since all the text is on the same line because there are no line breaks, it strips the entire message, thinking it is the original message.
* When Word is used, extra spaces are added inbetween lines.
fields.summary: Investigate Outlook editor behaviour in replying to JIRA HTML emails

Also, our subversion version is 0.9.1 not 0.8.2.  And according to the file name in the install directory itself, the RPC plugin is version 3.5.3-1 ("alassian-jira-rpc-plugin-3.5.3-1.jar") not 3.5.2-1.  This is just a sample. fields.description:
We have workflow transitions with a simple Update PostFunction that changes the AssignTo field to auto-assign the issue to a particular user.

We just upgraded from 3.3 to 3.6 and I noticed the poplist with available users has changed. I mean the poplist that is presented when editiing the PostFunction of the workflow step.

In 3.3 it used to show all users, now in 3.6 it only shows assignable users for the projects the current user is also assignable for. 

The workflow I'm editing is specific for a single project in our JIRA installation. The Jira administrator is NOT an assignable user for that project. This means that the assignable users for that project are not shown in the poplist.

I now have to make the Jira administrator an assignable user, which is not what I want to do :-(
fields.summary: Update workflow PostFunction does not show all users

fields.description:
We just upgraded from 3.3 to 3.6 and no my workflow stops working.

Whenever a workflow transition has the 'Assignee only' condition set and the screen used for the workflow transition allows setting the AssignTo field, the transition will fail (see screenshot)

Steps to reproduce the issue at will:
- copy the default jira worklow
- in this copied workflow change the 'Start Progress' step to use the 'Resolve Issue Screen'. This step already has the 'Assignee only' condition and the 'Resolve Issue Screen' has the AssignTo field.
- Create a new workflow scheme
- Assignt the copied workflow to All Unassigned Issue Types in this new workflow scheme
- Edit a project to use this new workflow scheme
- Logon as a jira-developer
- Create a new issue in this project
- Assign the issue to yourself
- Select the 'Start Progress' workflow action
- Set the AssignTo field to another user than yourself
- Click the StartProgress button
- The following error will apear: "Errors: Action 4 is invalid"
fields.summary: Invalid workflow action with 'Assignee only' condition and AssignTo field on transition screen

fields.description:

It's not always clear to users who the reporter is and why that one user is "missing" from the list.
fields.summary: Reporter doesn't show in Assignable users

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9960].

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 4 March 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request. While this feature is something we want to add to JIRA, it is not on the list of priorities for the next 12 months.

In the meantime, please check out these plugins:
* [Configuration Manager from Botron Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager] 
* [Project Configurator from Awnaba Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.awnaba.projectconfigurator.projectconfigurator]

on our Atlassian marketplace. 

Both of these plugins are available for the downloaded instances of JIRA and solve the use cases outlined in this requirement.

While we will not be addressing this feature in the next 12 months, we plan to resolve several other top voted feature requests in the next 12 months, including JRA-3156, JRA-3821, JRA-1431. And we have recently resolved JRA-32199, JRA-32200, JRA-2703 and JRA-7659 as well as provided the first drop of functionality related to JRA-3157.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

Currently JIRA crashes when importing workflows if referenced screens and statuses do not exist.

Jira should not need  the statuses or screens to have the same ids when importing workflows from one instance to another.

It makes it very difficult to import new workflows from a test/development instance to production. This use case is [explicitly documented |http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.6.1/workflow.html#copying_workflows].

Perhaps upon import, JIRA should ask whether to create new statuses, by default pre-filled with the workflow step name? For screens perhaps it could do something similar, or maybe remove the screens.

Either way JIRA should not crash on importing workflows at all.
fields.summary: Import workflow through XML should not rely on status and screen IDs

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to restrict the ability of users to set the fix version since this directly impacts the roadmap, etc.  For our project (Apache MyFaces) there are two level of users: regular users and developer.  The developers are the only ones who can assign an issue to an individual, and ideally, they would be the only ones who can assign the verison to be fixed.

Its not really appropriate for the bug reporter to decide when the issue is fixed.  I noticed the field is missing from this screen as I type so perhaps this is something that is already available?
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Fix Version Field

fields.description: At the moment deploying the JIRA dev kit requires that you have the correct version of the rpc and subversion plugins in neighboring directories. It is also a bit liberal as to the jars it will include depending on how many times you have deployed from the same source. We should clean up this mechanism, we should probably always download the libs fresh when we deploy and we need to have a mechanism for specifying which versions of the rpc and subversion plugins we should deploy.
fields.summary: Need to make a clean way of deploying the jira dev kit

fields.description:

Also, some of the current crop of news readers (eg Newsgator) don't seem to support earlier versions of RSS.  

I notice that this was done in Confluence a year ago (conf-2569), but doesn't seem to have made it into JIRA yet
fields.summary: Support RSS 2.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9951].
  {panel}

When I create a filter, the custom fields searchers shown depend on which issue type I have selected for the search. If the "Any" issue type is selected, only custom fields that are available in the Global context are searchable. To be able to search custom fields that are only available for specifik issue types, one of those types must be specified in a new search.

I have a setup where the Participants field (from the JIRA Toolkit Plugin) is only defined for the Bug, Improvement, New Feature and Usability (custom) Issue types. Most of the people that search the issue database are not aware of this restriction, as they generally only work with these issue types. When they search, for participants, they want to find _all_ issue with this particular participant, and therefor do not specify a specific Issue type to search. The problem is that because they do not specify one of the issue types for which the field is enabled, thay can not search the field at all.

What I miss is an option to allow all custom field searches to be shown when creating a new filter. I understand the need to limit the view if many custom fields have been defined. But when the Any issue type is selected in a new filter, a second Custom Fields section should be available that provides access to fields that only are available in for specific issue types.

I know this could probably be created as a plugin, but my company does not have the Java expertice available to do this. I also believe this would be a great addition to either JIRA itself or to the Toolkit Plugin that most people seem to have installes anyway.
fields.summary: Custom Field searchers should be accessible when the Any issue type is selected in Create New Filter

This is sort of similar to JRA-8514, but requesting email notifications for a different type of event.

When an issue gets a sub-task created, the people who are watching the main issue do not get an email notification. I suppose an 'issue created' event is fired, so just people associated with the new sub-task receive notification. Watchers of the parent issue get no notification.

Is there an easy workaround we could use to set up notifications like this?

Thanks,
Kim

fields.description:
Say we have a validator (eg. to test a field is set) on the Resolve screen. If an issue is bulk transitioned (resolved) and the validator *fails*, then:
 - The index is updated to show the resolution is set.
 - The issue itself shows no resolution, and none is set in the database.

Reindexing fixes the inconsistency.
fields.summary: Failing validators during bulk transition cause index to be updated incorrectly

fields.description:
Jira does fully implement SSH connectivity with Jsch. See the last few comments on the linked issue.

If OpenSSH is configured to such that "PasswordAuthentication=no" for security reasons, Jira is unable to connect to the SSH server. This affects CVS integration (and also seems to affect the SVN plugin as well.) This may also be causing problems with key-pair SSH authentication as well.

Turning the PasswordAuthentication setting off keeps the SSH client from sending the password to the server in cleartext through the negotiated encrypted tunnel, this approach is vulnerable to interception and later brute-force decryption of the tunnel. Turning the setting off causes the SSH client to encrypt the password with the negotiated private key before sending it to the server.

FYI - When this setting is off, a regular command line SSH client uses the "keyboard-interactive" authentication method instead.

The problem appears to be in the Jira's use of the Jsch package. I had originally posted this to Jsch's wiki as a potential issue with their library. However, they modified the result with information about how to configure their product to support keyboard-interactive authentication. The information can be found here: http://wiki.jsch.org/index.php?PasswordAuthentication - it looks like a simple fix and they've provided some links to reference code.

It's also worthwhile to note that Eclipse (both for build-in CVS connectivity and the Subsclipe plugin) uses Jsch and does not have trouble connecting to an SSH server with the PasswordAuthentication setting turned off.
fields.summary: Incomplete SSH integration with Jsch

fields.description:
Currently we have two PostFunctions to use in a workflow: AssignToReporter and UpdateIssueField.
Would it be possible to add the more generic "AssignTo" PostFunction for which I could select a specific user to assign the issue to.

Currently we use the UpdateIssueField to set the AssignTo field, but this does not trigger the Assigned Event (see also JRA-5181).

We have a highly customized workflow and about 50% of the transitions automatically assign the issue to a specific user who is responsible for the next phase. I would like the assignees to be notified of these transitions. 

Currently only the Updated Event is triggered. If I use that one to notify people they get the wrong email text.
fields.summary: AssignTo Post Function requested

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9913].
  {panel}

THE BYPRODUCT OF THIS ISSUE CAN BE LOST DATA/PRODUCTIVITY

I have validated this still exists in V3.6 of JIRA running on Atlassian's site.

Hotkeys such as Alt+F (File Menu) and Alt+E (Edit Menu) in Firefox are being overridden by JIRA. My improvement suggestion is to change the JIRA hotkeys to NOT duplicate those implemented by common browsers. 

Although IE does not cause pages to switch until you activate the link (by hitting enter or the space bar), Firefox activates the link immediately and thus leaves the user with no recourse to reclaim any comments they entered.

I've lost work on several occasions and am beginning to work around by typing in notepad first, but I am confident designers of JIRA would agree that this shouldn't be necessary especially when Alt+e then a is a very common shortcut for the Edit-Select All implementation in software.

I understand that not all users may experience the Alt+e problem since not all users have rights to edit JIRA issues. But the Alt-F feature (use the File menu) would also be overridden to the Find link in JIRA. ( just validated this and gladly cut my content to the clipboard before trying since all was lost hitting alt+F)

Another JIRA requested for a feature which allows the user to decide whether they want to be diverted from the edit mode they were in might be one approach, though could also be irritating as the "do you really want to delete the file" found in windows explorer but i digress.
fields.summary: JIRA Hotkeys duplicate browser Menu hotkeys

fields.description: Clicking on preview comment in an issue returns an alert dialog with value = Null. The icon just sits and spins after that.
fields.summary: Comment preview returns NULL alert dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9910].
  {panel}

Our JIRA users are requesting a feature that would automatically add a pre-defined list of people as watchers to each issue they create. Specifically, their manager has requested to be a watcher for each issue they create.

Example
When user-a creates an issue, they want manager-a to automatically be a watcher.
When user-b creates an issue, they want manager-b and manager-c to automatically be watchers.

This could either be configured...

...through the profile of user-a, saying that they want manager-a to be a watcher on all issue they create in any project.

and/or

...through the profile of manager-a, with a special permission, saying that they want to be a watcher on all issues created by user-a in any project.
fields.summary: Default watchers per reporter

fields.description:
As JRA-8631 is resolved now (User Picker Custom Fields should have drop-down-box for "Current User" etc. when searching for issues) there is another request:

While you can search for "Unassigned" for an assignee you cannot do an equal search on User Picker Custom Fields. I would expect to have something like "None" to search for.
fields.summary: User Picker Custom Fields should have an entry "None" when searching for issues
